refnamediv.refpurpose: Establishes a connection to a database.

listitem.para: For connectionWithURL:options:status:, an NSURL instance representing the location of the database to connect to.
For connectionWithURLString:options:status:, a string containing the location of the database to connect to, formatted as a URL.
An NSDictionary instance containing a set of options which should be applied to the new connection, or nil if no options are required.
See the description of initWithURL:options:status for further information on the options parameter.

A pointer to an NSError * pointer which will be modified in the event of an error to point to a new NSError instance describing the failure condition. If, for some reason, the details of the failure condition are not required, NULL may be supplied for this parameter.

The location pointed to by this parameter may or may not be modified in the event of a successful invocation: applications should not rely in this situation either upon no modification being made, nor upon it being modified to be NULL.

refsection.title: Return value
refsection.para: Upon success, connectionWithURL:options:status: returns a connection instance.
Upon failure, nil shall be returned, and if status is non-NULL, it shall be modified to point to an NSError instance describing the failure condition.

refsection.title: Discussion
refsection.para: Establishes a database connection given an NSURL and adds it to the autorelease pool.

The instance returned by a successful call to this method will be one defined by the driver which is registered for the scheme of the specified url. Applications should not generally need to be written with specific awareness of this, although developers should be aware that the instance returned will never be an instance of NGDBConnection itself.

It is not recommended that applications frequently establish connections to databases by creating autoreleased instances when database access is required, because there are no guarantees that establishing a connection will be an efficient operation.

Similarly, calling this method may cause name resolution to occur or remote network connections to be established, which could block the calling thread for some time. Applications should not call this method on a UI thread.

refsection.title: When to implement
refsection.para: Drivers should not need to override this method, and doing so will have no effect.
